div.l: (base) Though ȝe prolle ay ȝe schull it neuer fynde
(base) Ȝe ben as bolde as is bayard the blynde
(base) That blundreth forth and peril casteth he non
(base) He is as bold to renne agayn a stoon
(base) As for to go bysydes in the weye
(base) So fare ȝe that multiplie I seye
(base) If that ȝoure yȝen may not seen aright
(base) Loketh that ȝoure mynd lakke nought his sight
(base) For though ȝe loke neuer so brode and stare /
(base) Ȝe schulle nat wynne a myte in that chaffare
(base) But wasten al that ȝe may Rappe and renne
(base) Withdrawe the fir lest it so faste brenne
(base) Medleth nomore with that art I mene
(base) For if ȝe doon ȝour thrift is gon ful clene /
(base) And right as swithe I wol ȝou telle heere
(base) What that the philosophres sein in this matere /
(base) Lo thus seith arnold of the newe toun
(base) As his Rosarie maketh mencioun
(base) He seith right thus withouten eny lye
(base) Ther may no man mercurie mortifie
(base) But if it be with his brotheres knowleching
(base) How that he which that first seyde this thing /
(base) Of Philosophres fader was hermes /
(base) He saith how that the dragoun douteles
(base) Ne dyeth not but if he be slayn
(base) With his brother and that is for to sayn
(base) By the dragoun mercurie and non other
(base) He vnderstood and bremston were his brother
(base) That on of Sol and luna were y drawe
(base) And therfore sayde he tak heed to my sawe
(base) Lat no man busye him this art for to seche
(base) But he that the entencioun and the speche
(base) Of philosophres vnderstonde can
(base) And if he do he is a lewed man
(base) For this science and this connyng quod he /
(base) Is of the secre of Secrees parde
(base) Also ther was a disciple of Plato
(base) That on a tyme sayde his mayster to
(base) As his book Somer wil bere witnesse
(base) And this was his demaunde in sothfastnesse
(base) Telle me the name of the pryuy stoon
(base) And plato answerde vnto him anon
(base) Tak the stoon that titanos men name
(base) Which is that quod he magnasia the same /
(base) Seyde Plato ȝee Sire and is it thus
(base) This is ignotum per ignocius
(base) What is magnasia goode sire I pray /
(base) It is a water that is maad I say
(base) Of elementes foure quod Plato
(base) Tel me the roche goode sire quod he tho
(base) Of that water if it be ȝour wille
(base) Nay nay quod Plato certeyn that I nylle
(base) The Philosophres were sworn echon
(base) That they scholde discouere it to no mon
(base) Ne in no book it write in no manere
(base) For vnto crist it is so leef and deere
(base) That he wil nat that it discouered be
(base) But where it liketh to his deite
(base) Man to enspire and eek for to defende
(base) Whom that him liketh lo this is the ende
(base) Thanne conclude I thus sithens that god of heuene
(base) Ne wole nat that the Philosophres neuene
(base) How that a man schal come vnto this stoon
(base) I rede as for the beste lat it goon
(base) For who so maketh god his aduersarie
(base) As for to worche eny thing in contrarie /
(base) Vnto his wille certes neuer schal he thriue
(base) Though that he multiplie terme of his lyue
(base) And there a poynt for ended is my tale /
(base) God sende euery trewe man boote of his bale
